activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly M Carman

records.addlTxt:
1:12 PM Defendant Kimberly M Carman appeared by video in treatment facility in Madison.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Kimberly M Carman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about today being the final status date. Court asks when KC will be release.  KC doesn't have an answer. Attorney Zaleski state that KC is accepting the offer that has been provided and asks for another status date to resolve. Attorney Harper speaks about  not wanting to disrupt KC treatment. Court asks about the disposition. Attorney Zaleski speaks that the agreement is for 2 years of probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Approved by Judge McDougal

1:24 PM Defendant Kimberly M Carman in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Kimberly M Carman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski informs the court that we do not have a resolution in this case. Court sets another status date and a jury trial. Attorney Harper asks for a 1 day jury trial. Judge McDougal asks that all motion be filed timely.
Jury selection scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
9/14 Status rescheduled to accommodate Richland County Jury Trial.

2:53 PM Defendant Kimberly M Carman not in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Kimberly M Carman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Zaleski doesn't know where his client is and notes that there has been phone communications.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:32 PM Defendant Kimberly M Carman in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Kimberly M Carman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski waives the preliminary hearing which is presented to the court. KC concurs. Court finds probable cause. The court will file the information with the same charges. Attorney Zaleski stand mute on behalf of his client.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court rests for a waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:01 AM Defendant Kimberly M Carman in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  State asks for the warrant to be quashed. Max penalties stated by the court. Court speaks about counsel. Bond has already been set. Court quashes the arrest warrant.
